com.siemens.ct.exi.values
Interface Value

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractBinaryValue, AbstractValue, BinaryBase64Value, BinaryHexValue, BooleanValue, DateTimeValue, DecimalValue, FloatValue, IntegerValue, ListValue, QNameValue, StringValue
public interface Value
extends java.io.Serializable

Value is a container concept encapsulating value items, e.g. String Values but also Integers, Floats etc.

Version:
0.7
Author:
Daniel.Peintner.EXT@siemens.com, Joerg.Heuer@siemens.com

Method Summary
 int getCharactersLength()
          Length of string representation
 ValueType getValueType()
          Returns type of the boxed value e.g., int or boolean.
 char[] toCharacters(char[] cbuffer, int offset)
          Returns character array containing the values represented as String representation for XML Note: can be a different array than the one passed (e.g., String values).
 java.lang.String toString()
          Returns string representation.
 java.lang.String toString(char[] cbuffer, int offset)
          Returns string representation by making use of the passed character array.
 

Method Detail

getValueType

ValueType getValueType()
Returns type of the boxed value e.g., int or boolean.

Note: can be a string-type even if integer-type is expected (e.g., if Preserve.LexicalValues is set to TRUE).

Returns:
associated value type

toCharacters

char[] toCharacters(char[] cbuffer,
                    int offset)
Returns character array containing the values represented as String representation for XML

Note: can be a different array than the one passed (e.g., String values). In those cases the array has exactly getCharactersLength() size

Parameters:
cbuffer -
offset -
Returns:
string representation of value

getCharactersLength

int getCharactersLength()
Length of string representation

Returns:
string length

toString

java.lang.String toString(char[] cbuffer,
                          int offset)
Returns string representation by making use of the passed character array.

Parameters:
cbuffer -
offset -
Returns:
String representation

toString

java.lang.String toString()
Returns string representation. Please consider using toString(char[] cbuffer, int offset).

Returns:
